Html: It will be fine to merge "Ascend" and "CustomerBorderForm". Take a look ;-)

I agree that having a centralized code base would be good for the community. The people at Drawing Custom Borders in Windows Forms would be more than welcome to join us. I would not want or be able to put their code in this project without their permission. (I know this is not what you are suggesting :-)) We have worked hard; as I'm sure they have, to have the project recognition that we have. Maybe if they read this they might want to join this project?

Thanks,
Scorn

Hi,

I'm a developer working on the "CustomBorderSkin" project and I think it would be great to have a discussion on the shared goals we may have.

However, this is up to Kobush to really look at it.

From my end I think we would all learn and win something out of it: not talking of the developers willing to use both APIs for their own projects.

I will place a post in your forum and see what we can share. :-)

Thanks,
Scorn
